title: Enterprise Business Development Manager, Thailand
summary: The people here at Apple don’t just create products — they create the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspire the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it!
description:
Key Responsibilities
-  Analysis and identification of macro risks and opportunities for Thailand channel’s performance in the short and medium term.
-  Formulate plans to enhance business performance in collaboration with Account Managers.
-  Development of management tools to support capability and efficiency improvements with the Sales Team. These tools include reports, analysis, insights, processes, and templates.
-  Collaborate closely with the Central Business Management Team and Sales Team to devise and implement business development programs (e.g., finance, lease, trade-in, solution bundles) suitable for channel partners in the country.
-  Establish and manage close working relationships, in conjunction with Account Managers, with channel partners at all levels. Ensure effective performance management, implement relevant consumer programs, and maximize sales of Apple products to end-users.
-  Always represent the Apple brand at the highest level.
APPLE VALUES
-  Ability to work well in groups and without routine direct supervision.
-  Take initiative and challenge the status quo.
-  Deliver more than the customer expects.
-  Be dependable and reliable – follow up quickly and consistently.
-  Demonstrate a positive and approachable demeanor.
key_qualifications:
Strong problem-solving skills to identify critical issues, evaluate options, and provide recommendations.
Robust business planning capabilities, with the ability to work within and design processes leading to the development of innovative and commercially driven sales plans.
Awareness of local channel structure, emerging trends, and competitor activities in the market. Ability to create and capitalize on opportunities.
Proven track record in galvanizing, developing, and motivating cross-functional performing teams that may include diverse members.
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills and experience presenting to senior-level executives.
Relevant work experience in strategy consulting or business development is preferred
Enthusiasm, personal drive, and a sense of humor.
